page.title: 14Littlecote House
page.content: of{Sir John Popham.}He was born in 1531 and he died in 1606. He was a Judge and he had a special chair called a{"turreny}chair".It was made of Ash wood and it felt rather hard and knobbly. It looked most uncomfortable, but I am sure he had a cushion to sit on. There was also a very long table. It was called a{Shove Halfpenny Table. It was very long and made of oak. It was built in the Hall, in one piece and it can never be taken out of the room. It has netting around one end. The players used to send coins down the table as far as they could without sending the coin off the end. You would also try to knock your opponant's coin off the table.The guide said that the Roundhead soldiers used to play at the table, but I thought that the Roundheads were too
